codingTips: In VSCode if a variable is dimmed, it means that the variable hasn't been used, often a good hint you mistyped the variable elsewhere
If you see a white dot in the tab in VScode, it means the file has not yet been saved yet, keep an eye out for that.
The Chrome devTools tab is your best friend when making HTTP calls to APIs and other sources, learn how it works and what information it displays
console has other functions like table, count and error to help you in debugging, learn them and use them
Read the documentation and MDN can be really illuminating as to how Javascript works
